title: [Large-Scale] MOOC on Computational Thinking and Robotics for Early Childhood and Elementary Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and general understanding of educational curricula
context.additional_context: An online course for university students providing blended learning models for computational thinking, programming, and robotics education applicable to early childhood and elementary education

learning_goals: Explain methods to apply core concepts of computational thinking (decomposition, pattern recognition, abstraction, algorithms) in educational settings
Design educational activities for early childhood and elementary levels using block-based programming tools (e.g., Scratch)
Plan and implement basic coding activities using robotics kits

Learners design ≥3 specific strategies in a blended learning environment over four weeks: (1) flipped learning linking video discussions and LMS quizzes, (2) PBL combining small-group activities and feedback sessions, (3) offline customized feedback using online quiz results. They then submit proposals meeting ≥4.0/5.0 in peer evaluations (by ≥3 peers) and ≥80% (16/20) in instructor rubric assessments.

resources: Scratch and Other Educational Programming Tools

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
